snippet: Two leading fiscal conservatives, Representative Eric Cantor and Senator Tom Coburn, declared their loyalties for the first time on Sunday, with John Ashcroft set to join the team Monday.
abstract: Reluctant Republican Party is increasingly showing signs of rallying around Mitt Romney in the presidential race, with leading members of Congress and influential conservatives signaling that a coast-to-coast burst of voting on Super Tuesday should mark a moment to start concentrating on defeating President Obama; two leading fiscal conservatives, Representative Eric Cantor and Senator Tom Coburn, declare their Romney loyalties for the first time, with John Ashcroft set to join the team.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and JIM RUTENBERG
byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Snellville, Ga., Robbie Brown from Memphis and Richard A. Oppel Jr. from Oklahoma City.

lead_paragraph: Two leading fiscal conservatives, Representative Eric Cantor and Senator Tom Coburn, declared their loyalties for the first time on Sunday, with John Ashcroft set to join the team Monday.

headline.main: Before Super Tuesday, Big Names Rally to Romney
headline.print_headline: Before Pivotal Tuesday Votes, Big Names Rally to Romney
